docs.title: Introducing Maira
docs.text: Maira is an operator friendly low code workflow platform to automate day-2 activities. Using Maira, the operations team (be it CloudOps, SRE, SecOps NetOps, or anyOps) or developers can rapidly develop sophisticated human-in-loop stateful automation, as code.

docs.title: Bridging the gap between Dev-friendly and Low Code.
docs.text:
Most of the low-code platforms out there aim to help non-developers automate their day-to-day tasks. Low-code platforms generally enable non-technical employees to develop their applications, eliminating the need to rely on IT departments to change existing applications or create new ones. However, this comes with compromises like limitations to customization, scalability, and security concerns. However, the biggest drawback lies in developing and maintaining moderate to high-complexity applications. In the Ops environment, automation scripts are tweaked quite frequently. Hence, a typical low-code environment backed by YAML or other markup language is unsuitable, as it boxes the end user to a visual interface to develop anything. Version control etc. is very painful or impossible.

Maira is architected to provide the full power of a high-level language to automation developers. It enables developers to create 'stateful workflows' using a Python-like imperative language which provides a sophisticated development environment without compromising on the benefits of workflows. Workflows typically are very good at failure recovery and scaling. However, they offer a constrained development environment and require a different kind of thinking. Today ops teams are used to the power of a general-purpose language like Python which allows them to create complex automation scripts. Now with Maira, the same flexibility is available, and using the out of box integrations, they can develop fail-proof, scalable, long-running applications with much less code. In addition, non-programmers can use the familiar drag-and-drop visual interface to develop automation if they so choose to. Maira's DSL, called MPL, can execute this automation with Maira's workflow orchestrator in the cloud or on-prem.

docs.title: Use cases
docs.text:
Operators use Maira for various use cases. Some of them are listed below. Maira is evolving continuously with new integrations and language capabilities. Feel free to reach out to us for any automation use cases you can think of.

  • Manual and automated troubleshooting.
  • Trigger workflows on receiving events to collect system state in real-time.
  • Automatically respond to security events. Notify the impacted user and take action based on the user's input.
  • Periodic compliance tasks like certificate rotation, password reset, etc.
  • Manage cloud costs by continuously monitoring, notifying, and deleting resources after approval.
  • Various human-in-loop automation tasks using notification and survey features on slack.
  • Segmenting access to the production cluster within the team using Maira's sophisticated RBAC capabilities.
  • Upgrade or deploy security patches on a large number of target devices.
  • Generate periodic reports as needed for compliance and user tracking.

docs.title: confirm
docs.text: Confirm with an authorized user

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Confirm with an authorized user if we should proceed with the next action in the playbook

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
confirm
    <message>
    [--approver <approver>]

docs.title: message - (string)
docs.text: message to be sent for confirmation      Example: "message-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: approver - (string)
docs.text: user, group or group:role who needs to approve      Example: --approver "kafka:admin"      Default: default:admin      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: confirm "message-1"

docs.title: curl
docs.text: CURL a given URL

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Use CURL command to get a given URL

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
curl
    [--site <site>]
    [--request|-X <request>]
    [--data|-d <data>]
    [--header|-H <header>]
    [--ssl]
    [--insecure]
    <url>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site to run the command      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: request - (string)
docs.text: Request command to use      Example: --request "POST"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: data - (string)
docs.text: HTTP POST data      Example: --data "data-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: header - (string)
docs.text: Custom headers      Example: --header "Host: www.maira.io"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: ssl - (bool)
docs.text: Use SSL      Example: --ssl      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: insecure - (bool)
docs.text: Allow insecure server connections when using SSL      Example: --insecure      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: url - (string)
docs.text: URL to get      Example: "www.maira.io"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

!curl "https://demo.maira.io"

docs.title: send-email
docs.text: Send an email

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Send an email with an existing template or with a subject and body

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
send-email
    --to <to>
    [--cc <cc>]
    [--subject <subject>]
    [--body <body>]
    [--template <template>]
    [<template_args>]

docs.title: to - (string)
docs.text: Addressses to which email is to be sent      Example: --to "to-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: cc - (string)
docs.text: Addressses to which email is Cc-ed      Example: --cc "cc-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: subject - (string)
docs.text: Subject of the email      Example: --subject "subject-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: body - (string)
docs.text: Body of the email      Example: --body "body-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: template - (string)
docs.text: Template to be used for sending the email. Template/args are mutually exclusive with subject/body      Example: --template "template-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: template_args - (string)
docs.text: Template arguments(json) to be used for sending the email      Example: "template_args-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! send-email --to "varghese@maira.io" --subject "Hello" --body "Hello there"
Output: 
Email Sent!
Input: 
! send-email --to "varghese@maira.io" --template "d-09e71fe13d354a90aedf1bb8e733d8c7" `{"name":"Varghese", "message":"Hello"}`
Output: 
Email Sent!

docs.title: ssh
docs.text: Run a command on a remote server using ssh

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Run a command on a remote server using ssh

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
ssh
    [--site <site>]
    <server>
    <command>
    [--insecure_ignore_host_key]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site to run the command      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: server - (string)
docs.text: server to run the command on      Example: "server1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: command - (string)
docs.text: command to run      Example: "ls -l"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: insecure_ignore_host_key - (bool)
docs.text: ignore host key verification (insecure)      Example: --insecure_ignore_host_key      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! ssh --site "localhost:8080" "host1" "ls -a"
Output: 
.
..
.bash_history
.bashrc
.cache
.profile

docs.title: appd create-event
docs.text: Create events for an application

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create event for an application

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
appd create-event
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <application>
    [--summary <summary>]
    [--type <type>]
    [--severity <severity>]
    [--propertynames <propertynames>]
    [--propertyvalues <propertyvalues>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "appdynamics-default"      Default: appdynamics-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: application - (string)
docs.text: application name or ID      Example: "app-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: summary - (string)
docs.text: Provides the summary for the event.      Example: --summary "sample summary"      Default: This is summary of a sample event when the input is not provided      Attributes: optional

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: Enter the event type      Example: --type "APPLICATION_ERROR"      Default: CUSTOM      Attributes: optional

docs.title: severity - (string)
docs.text: Provides the severity level. Allowec values - INFO, WARN, ERROR      Example: --severity "INFO"      Default: INFO      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: INFO, WARN, ERROR

docs.title: propertynames - (string)
docs.text: Input property names      Example: --propertynames "key1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: propertyvalues - (string)
docs.text: Input property values      Example: --propertyvalues "value1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: appd create-event "app-1" --propertynames "key1" --propertyvalues "value1"

docs.title: appd delete-collector
docs.text: Delete a collector

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Delete a collector with configuration ID

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
appd delete-collector
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --id <id>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "appdynamics-default"      Default: appdynamics-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: id - (int)
docs.text: configuration-id for deleting the collector      Example: --id 562      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: appd delete-collector --id 562

docs.title: appd get-actions

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get all actions of a given application ID

docs.title: Synopsis

    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <application>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "appdynamics-default"      Default: appdynamics-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: application - (string)
docs.text: application name or ID      Example: "app-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: appd get-actions "app-1"

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "appdynamics-default"      Default: appdynamics-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: appd get-collector
docs.text: Retrieve collector

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns collector if ID is provided. Else, returns all collectors

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
appd get-collector
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [<id>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "appdynamics-default"      Default: appdynamics-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: id - (int)
docs.text: configuration-id(s) for retrieving the collector(s)      Example: 562      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

x = ! appd get-collector --site "localhost:8081" 562

docs.title: appd get-dbagent-events
docs.text: Retrieve DB agent events

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get all Database Agent Events

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
appd get-dbagent-events
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [--start_time <start_time>]
    [--end_time <end_time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "appdynamics-default"      Default: appdynamics-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start_time - (time)
docs.text: time from which to get events data      Example: --start_time "30m ago"      Default: 30m ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (time)
docs.text: time to which to get events data      Example: --end_time "now"      Default: now      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: appd get-dbagent-events

docs.title: appd get-events
docs.text: Get events in an application

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get events of a specific event type occurred in an application in a specific time period

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
appd get-events
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <application>
    [--type <type>]
    [--severity <severity>]
    [--start_time <start_time>]
    [--end_time <end_time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "appdynamics-default"      Default: appdynamics-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: application - (string)
docs.text: application name or ID      Example: "app-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: Type of the events.      Example: --type "CUSTOM"      Default: APPLICATION_CONFIG_CHANGE      Attributes: optional

docs.title: severity - (string)
docs.text: Provides the severity levels.      Example: --severity "INFO"      Default: INFO      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start_time - (time)
docs.text: time from which to get metrics data      Example: --start_time "15m ago"      Default: 15m ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (time)
docs.text: time to which to get metrics data      Example: --end_time "now"      Default: now      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: appd get-events "app-1"

docs.title: bitbucket search-issues
docs.text: Search bitbucket issues

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Search bitbucket issues based on the given query

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
bitbucket search-issues
    [--site <site>]
    --repo <repo>
    <query>
    [--sort <sort>]
    [--page <page>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: repo - (string)
docs.text: Fully Qualified Repository Name for issue      Example: --repo "bitbucket_user1/test_repo_1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Query string in bitbucket query format      Example: "state="new" AND title ~ "text""      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: sort - (string)
docs.text: What to sort results by      Example: --sort "created_on" , --sort "updated_on" , --sort "priotity"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: page - (int)
docs.text: Page number of the results to fetch. Default- 1      Example: --page 2      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x = !bitbucket search-issues --site "localhost:8080" --repo "simulage/daccosim" 'title ~ "Matryoshka.jar"'
Output: 
{
    "values": [
        {
            "type": "issue",
            "id": 32,

docs.title: cloudwatch describe-alarm
docs.text: Describe cloudwatch alarms

docs.title: Description
docs.text: show details about cloudwatch alarms

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
cloudwatch describe-alarm
    [--site <site>]
    [--region <region>]
    [<names>]
    [--action_prefix <action_prefix>]
    [--name_prefix <name_prefix>]
    [--state <state>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: AWS region for the service      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: names - (string)
docs.text: Specific alarm names to look for      Example: "names-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: action_prefix - (string)
docs.text: To only filter those alarms that use a certain alarm action      Example: --action_prefix "action_prefix-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name_prefix - (string)
docs.text: Prefix for the alarm name      Example: --name_prefix "name_prefix-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: state - (string)
docs.text: Filter alarms that are currently in the specified state      Example: --state "state-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples

docs.title: cloudwatch get-metric-data
docs.text: Retrieve CloudWatch metric values

docs.title: Description
docs.text: retrieve CloudWatch metric values

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
cloudwatch get-metric-data
    [--site <site>]
    [--region <region>]
    --start_time <start_time>
    --end_time <end_time>
    --query <query>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: AWS region for the service      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start_time - (time)
docs.text: The time stamp indicating the earliest data to be returned      Example: --start_time "1h ago"      Default: 1h ago      Attributes: required

docs.title: end_time - (time)
docs.text: The time stamp indicating the latest data to be returned      Example: --end_time "now"      Default: now      Attributes: required

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: The metric queries to be returned. A single GetMetricData call can include as many as 500 MetricDataQuery structures      Example: --query "query-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: cloudwatch get-metric-data --region "region-1" --query "query-1"

docs.title: cloudwatch get-metric-stats
docs.text: Retrieve CloudWatch metric statistics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: retrieve CloudWatch metric statistics

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
cloudwatch get-metric-stats
    [--site <site>]
    [--region <region>]
    <name>
    --start_time <start_time>
    --end_time <end_time>
    --namespace <namespace>
    [--unit <unit>]
    [--stat <stat>]
    [--extended_stat <extended_stat>]
    --period <period>
    [--dimensions <dimensions>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: AWS region for the service      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the metric, with or without spaces      Example: "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: start_time - (time)
docs.text: The time stamp indicating the earliest data to be returned      Example: --start_time "60m ago"      Default: 60m ago      Attributes: required

docs.title: end_time - (time)
docs.text: The time stamp indicating the latest data to be returned      Example: --end_time "now"      Default: now      Attributes: required

docs.title: namespace - (string)
docs.text: The namespace of the metric, with or without spaces      Example: --namespace "namespace-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: unit - (string)
docs.text: The unit for a given metric      Example: --unit "Seconds" , --unit "Bytes" , --unit "Percent" , --unit "Count" , --unit "Bytes/Second"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: Seconds, Microseconds, Milliseconds, Bytes, Kilobytes, Megabytes, Gigabytes, Terabytes, Bits, Kilobits, Megabits, Gigabits, Terabits, Percent, Count, Bytes/Second, Kilobytes/Second, Megabytes/Second, Gigabytes/Second, Terabytes/Second, Bits/Second, Kilobits/Second, Megabits/Second, Gigabits/Second, Terabits/Second, Count/Second, None

docs.title: stat - (string)
docs.text: The unit for a given metric      Example: --stat "SampleCount" , --stat "Average" , --stat "Sum" , --stat "Maximum" , --stat "Minimum"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed      Validation:          allowed values: SampleCount, Average, Sum, Maximum, Minimum

docs.title: extended_stat - (string)
docs.text: The percentile stats for a given metric      Example: --extended_stat "p0.1" , --extended_stat "p99"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: period - (int)
docs.text: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points      Example: --period * Start time between 3 hours and 15 days ago - Use a multiple of 60 seconds (1 minute). * Start time between 15 and 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 300 seconds (5 minutes). * Start time greater than 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 3600 seconds (1 hour).      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: dimensions - (string)
docs.text: The dimensions to filter against      Example: --dimensions "{"Class":"None"}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: cloudwatch get-metric-stats --region "region-1" "name-1" --namespace "namespace-1" --unit "Seconds" --stat "SampleCount" --extended_stat "p0.1" --period * Start time between 3 hours and 15 days ago - Use a multiple of 60 seconds (1 minute). * Start time between 15 and 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 300 seconds (5 minutes). * Start time greater than 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 3600 seconds (1 hour). --dimensions "{"Class":"None"}"

docs.title: cloudwatch list-metrics
docs.text: List the specified metrics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: list the specified metrics

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
cloudwatch list-metrics
    [--site <site>]
    [--region <region>]
    [--namespace <namespace>]
    [<name>]
    [--dimensions <dimensions>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: AWS region for the service      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: namespace - (string)
docs.text: The metric namespace to filter against      Example: --namespace "namespace-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the metric to filter against      Example: "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: dimensions - (string)
docs.text: The dimensions to filter against      Example: --dimensions "{"Class":"None"}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x=! cloudwatch list-metrics --site "localhost:8081"
Output: 
[
  {
    "metric_name": "CallCount",
    "namespace": "AWS/Usage",
    "dimensions": {
      "Class": "None",
      "Resource": "ListBuckets",
      "Service": "S3",
      "Type": "API"
    }
  },
  {
    "metric_name": "DatabaseConnections",
    "namespace": "AWS/RDS",
    "dimensions": {
      "DatabaseClass": "db.t3.micro"
    }
  }
]
Input: 
! cloudwatch list-metrics --site "localhost:8081"
Output: 
METRIC NAME                     NAMESPACE 
CallCount                       AWS/Usage
DatabaseConnections             AWS/RDS

docs.title: cloudwatch set-alarm-state

cloudwatch set-alarm-state
    [--site <site>]
    [--region <region>]

    --reason <reason>
    [--reason_data <reason_data>]
    --state <state>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: AWS region for the service      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the alarm      Example: "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: reason - (string)
docs.text: The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state, in text format      Example: --reason "reason-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: reason_data - (string)
docs.text: The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state, in JSON format      Example: --reason_data "reason_data-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: state - (string)
docs.text: The value of the state      Example: --state "state-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples

docs.title: datadog add-tags-host
docs.text: This endpoint allows you to add new tags to a host, optionally specifying where these tags come from

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This endpoint allows you to add new tags to a host, optionally specifying where these tags come from

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog add-tags-host
    [--site <site>]
    [--source <source>]
    --host <host>
    [--tags <tags>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: source - (string)
docs.text: filters host list to those tags with the specified source.      Example: --source "source-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: host - (string)
docs.text: Name of host.      Example: --host "host-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: tags - (string)
docs.text: A list of tags to apply to the host.      Example: --tags "tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: datadog add-tags-host --source "source-1" --host "host-1" --tags "tags-1"

docs.title: datadog aggregate-logs
docs.text: aggregate events into buckets and compute metrics and timeseries

docs.title: Description
docs.text: aggregate events into buckets and compute metrics and timeseries

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog aggregate-logs
    [--site <site>]
    --aggregation <aggregation>
    [--interval <interval>]
    [--metric <metric>]
    [--type <type>]
    [--query <query>]
    [--index <index>]
    [--from <from>]
    [--to <to>]
    [--storage_tier <storage_tier>]
    [--cursor <cursor>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: aggregation - (string)
docs.text: An aggregation function      Example: --aggregation "count"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          allowed values: count, cardinality, pc75, pc90, pc95, pc98, pc99, sum, min, max, avg, median

docs.title: interval - (string)
docs.text: The time buckets' size (only used for type=timeseries) Defaults to a resolution of 150 points      Example: --interval "interval-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: metric - (string)
docs.text: The metric to use      Example: --metric "metric-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: The type of compute      Example: --type "total"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: timeseries, total

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Search query following logs syntax.      Example: --query "query-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: For customers with multiple indexes, the indexes to search Defaults to '*' which means all indexes      Example: --index "index-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: from - (time)
docs.text: Minimum timestamp for requested logs      Example: --from "15 min ago"      Default: 15 min ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: to - (time)
docs.text: Maximum timestamp for requested logs      Example: --to "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: storage_tier - (string)
docs.text: Specifies the storage type to be used      Example: --storage_tier "indexes"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: indexes, online-archives

docs.title: cursor - (string)
docs.text: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query      Example: --cursor "cursor-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!datadog aggregate-logs --aggregation "avg" --index "main" --query "*"
Output: 
BUCKET-BY     BUCKET-COMPUTES
bucketBy1     bucketCompute1       
bucketBy2     bucketCompute2

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: The archive query/filter. Logs matching this query are included in the archive      Example: --query "query-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: rehydration_size - (int)
docs.text: Maximum scan size for rehydration in gb from this archive      Example: --rehydration_size 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: rehydration_tags - (string)
docs.text: An array of tags to add to rehydrated logs from an archive      Example: --rehydration_tags "rehydration_tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: container - (string)
docs.text: The container/Bucket where the archive will be stored      Example: --container "container-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: path - (string)
docs.text: The archive path      Example: --path "path-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: The Azure region where the archive will be stored      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: client_id - (string)
docs.text: client ID      Example: --client_id "client_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: tenant_id - (string)
docs.text: tenant ID      Example: --tenant_id "tenant_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: storage_account - (string)
docs.text: associated storage account      Example: --storage_account "storage_account-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: datadog create-log-archive-azure --name "name-1" --query "query-1" --rehydration_size 1 --rehydration_tags "rehydration_tags-1" --container "container-1" --path "path-1" --region "region-1" --client_id "client_id-1" --tenant_id "tenant_id-1" --storage_account "storage_account-1"

docs.title: datadog create-log-index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a new index

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog create-log-index
    [--site <site>]
    --query <query>
    --name <name>
    [--retention_days <retention_days>]
    [--daily_limit <daily_limit>]
    --exclusion_filters <exclusion_filters>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: The filter query      Example: --query "query-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the index      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: retention_days - (int)
docs.text: The number of days before logs are deleted from this index. Available values depend on organization's subscriptions      Example: --retention_days 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: daily_limit - (int)
docs.text: The number of log events you can send in this index per day before you are rate-limited      Example: --daily_limit 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: exclusion_filters - (string)
docs.text: json string of exclusion object      Example: --exclusion_filters "{ "filter": { "query": "*", "sample_rate": 1 }, "is_enabled": false, "name": "name of filter" }"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.text:
Input: 

!datadog create-log-index
Output: 
NAME            FILTER-QUERY    RETENTION-DAYS  EXCLUSION-FILTERS 
sdcsdfcsfddddd  source:python               15  payment, payment

docs.title: datadog create-monitor
docs.text: Create a monitor using the specified options

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create a monitor using the specified options

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog create-monitor
    [--site <site>]
    [--message <message>]
    [--name <name>]
    [--priority <priority>]
    --query <query>
    [--restricted_roles <restricted_roles>]
    [--tags <tags>]
    --type <type>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: message - (string)
docs.text: A message to include with notifications for this monitor      Example: --message "message-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The monitor name      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: priority - (int)
docs.text: Integer from 1 (high) to 5 (low) indicating alert severity      Example: --priority 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: The monitor query      Example: --query "query-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: restricted_roles - (string)
docs.text: A list of unique role identifiers to define which roles are allowed to edit the monitor      Example: --restricted_roles "restricted_roles-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: tags - (string)
docs.text: Tags associated to your monitor      Example: --tags "tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: The type of the monitor      Example: --type "type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          allowed values: composite, event alert, log alert, metric alert, process alert, query alert, rum alert, service check, synthetics alert, trace-analytics alert, slo alert, event-v2 alert, audit alert, ci-pipelines alert, ci-tests alert, error-tracking alert

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!datadog create-monitor --query "avg(last_5m):sum:system.net.bytes_rcvd{host:host0} > 100" --type "query alert" --message "create moniotr" --name "testNames2" --tags "testta" --priority 3
Output: 
ID      ORG-ID      NAME        MESSAGE         TYPE        
78570   1300017267  testNames2  create moniotr  query alert

docs.title: datadog get-active-metrics
docs.text: Get the list of actively reporting metrics from a given time until now

docs.text: Get the list of actively reporting metrics from a given time until now

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog get-active-metrics
    [--site <site>]
    --from <from>
    [--host <host>]
    [--tag_filter <tag_filter>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: from - (string)
docs.text: Seconds since the Unix epoch      Example: --from "from-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: tag_filter - (string)

docs.title: datadog get-custom-metrics
docs.text: Get all custom metrics by hourly average.can change resolution

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get all custom metrics by hourly average.can change resolution

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog get-custom-metrics
    [--site <site>]
    [--month <month>]
    [--day <day>]
    [--names <names>]
    [--limit <limit>]
    [--next <next>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: month - (time)
docs.text: usage beginning at this hour. (Either month or day should be specified, but not both)      Example: --month "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: 5 hour ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: day - (time)
docs.text: usage beginning at this hour. (Either month or day should be specified, but not both)      Example: --day "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: 5 hour ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: names - (string)
docs.text: metric names      Example: --names "names-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: limit - (int)
docs.text: Maximum number of results to return (between 1 and 5000) - defaults to 500 results if limit not specified      Example: --limit 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: next - (string)
docs.text: List following results with a next_record_id provided in the previous query      Example: --next "next-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: datadog get-custom-metrics --names "names-1" --limit 1 --next "next-1"

docs.title: datadog get-hosts
docs.text: Allows searching for hosts by name, alias, or tag. Hosts live within the past 3 hours are included by default

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Allows searching for hosts by name, alias, or tag. Hosts live within the past 3 hours are included by default

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog get-hosts
    [--site <site>]
    [--filter <filter>]
    [--sort_field <sort_field>]
    [--sort_dir <sort_dir>]
    [--start <start>]
    [--count <count>]
    [--from <from>]
    [--include_muted_hosts_data]
    [--include_hosts_metadata]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter - (string)
docs.text: String to filter search results      Example: --filter "filter-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: sort_field - (string)
docs.text: Sort hosts by this field      Example: --sort_field "sort_field-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: sort_dir - (string)
docs.text: Direction of sort      Example: --sort_dir "sort_dir-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: asc, desc

docs.title: start - (int)
docs.text: Host result to start search from      Example: --start 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: count - (int)
docs.text: Number of hosts to return. Max 1000      Example: --count 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: from - (time)
docs.text: time from which you want to search your hosts      Example: --from "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: 1 hour ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: include_muted_hosts_data - (bool)
docs.text: Include information on the muted status of hosts and when the mute expires      Example: --include_muted_hosts_data      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: include_hosts_metadata - (bool)
docs.text: Include additional metadata about the hosts (agent_version, machine, platform, processor, etc.)      Example: --include_hosts_metadata      Default: false      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: datadog get-hosts --filter "filter-1" --sort_field "sort_field-1" --sort_dir "sort_dir-1" --start 1 --count 1 --include_muted_hosts_data

docs.title: datadog get-hourly-usage-attribution

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start - (time)
docs.text: For usage beginning at this hour      Example: --start "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: 3 days ago      Attributes: required

docs.title: end - (time)
docs.text: For usage ending before this hour      Example: --end "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: usage - (string)
docs.text: Usage type to retrieve      Example: --usage "usage-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          allowed values: api, apm_fargate, apm_host, appsec_fargate, appsec, browser, container, cspm_containers, cspm_hosts, custom_timeseries, cws_containers, cws_hosts, dbm_hosts, dbm_queries, estimated_indexed_logs, estimated_ingested_logs, estimated_indexed_spans, estimated_ingested_spans, fargate, functions, indexed_logs, infra_host, invocations, npm_host, profiled_container, profiled_host, snmp, estimated_rum_sessions, cont

docs.title: next - (string)

docs.title: tag_breakdown - (string)
docs.text: If no value is provided the usage will not be broken down by tags      Example: --tag_breakdown "tag_breakdown-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: exclude_descendants - (bool)
docs.text: Include child org usage in the response      Example: --exclude_descendants      Default: false      Attributes: optional

docs.title: datadog get-monitor-details
docs.text: Get data of monitors

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get data of monitors

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog get-monitor-details
    [--site <site>]
    [--monitor <monitor>]
    [--group_states <group_states>]
    [--name <name>]
    [--tags <tags>]
    [--monitor_tags <monitor_tags>]
    [--downtimes]
    [--offset <offset>]
    [--page <page>]
    [--page_size <page_size>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: monitor - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the monitor      Example: --monitor 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: group_states - (string)
docs.text: When specified, shows additional information about the group states      Example: --group_states "group_states-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: all, alert, warn, no data

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: A string to filter monitors by name      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: tags - (string)
docs.text: A comma separated list indicating what tags, if any, should be used to filter the list of monitors by scope. For example, host:host0      Example: --tags "tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: monitor_tags - (string)
docs.text: A comma separated list indicating what service and/or custom tags, if any, should be used to filter the list of monitors      Example: --monitor_tags "monitor_tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: downtimes - (bool)
docs.text: If this argument is set to true, then the returned data includes all current active downtimes for each monitor      Example: --downtimes      Default: false      Attributes: optional

docs.title: offset - (int)
docs.text: Use this parameter for paginating through large sets of monitors      Example: --offset 1      Default: 0      Attributes: optional

docs.title: page - (int)
docs.text: The page to start paginating from      Example: --page 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: page_size - (int)
docs.text: The number of monitors to return per page      Example: --page_size 1      Default: 50      Attributes: optional

docs.text:
Input: 

!datadog get-monitor-details
Output:

78568   testNamed   query alert create moniotr         3    avg(last_5m):sum:system.net.bytes_rcvd{host:host0} > 100    Avinash Bharti - EXT    
78569   testNames   query alert create moniotr         3    avg(last_5m):sum:system.net.bytes_rcvd{host:host0} > 100    Avinash Bharti - EXT    
78570   testNames2  query alert create moniotr         3    avg(last_5m):sum:system.net.bytes_rcvd{host:host0} > 100    Avinash Bharti - EXT
Input: 
!datadog get-monitor-details --monitor 78566

78566   testName    query alert create moniotr         3    avg(last_5m):sum:system.net.bytes_rcvd{host:host0} > 100    Avinash Bharti - EXT

docs.title: datadog list-events
docs.text: The event stream can be queried and filtered

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The event stream can be queried and filtered

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog list-events
    [--site <site>]
    [--event <event>]
    --start <start>
    --end <end>
    [--priority <priority>]
    [--sources <sources>]
    [--tags <tags>]
    [--unaggregated]
    [--exclude_aggregate]
    [--page <page>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: event - (string)
docs.text: Id for specific event search      Example: --event "event-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start - (time)
docs.text: search events after this time      Example: --start "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: 1 hour ago      Attributes: required

docs.title: end - (time)
docs.text: search events before this time      Example: --end "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: priority - (string)
docs.text: Priority of your events, either low or normal      Example: --priority "priority-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: normal, low

docs.title: sources - (string)
docs.text: Sources.      Example: --sources "sources-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: tags - (string)
docs.text: Tags, if any, should be used to filter the list of events      Example: --tags "tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: unaggregated - (bool)
docs.text: Set unaggregated to true to return all events within the specified [start,end] timeframe      Example: --unaggregated      Default: false      Attributes: optional

docs.title: exclude_aggregate - (bool)
docs.text: If the exclude_aggregate parameter is set to true, then the unaggregated parameter is ignored and will be true by default      Example: --exclude_aggregate      Default: false      Attributes: optional

docs.title: page - (int)
docs.text: Set page to the number of the page to return with 0 being the first page 1000 results are returned per request      Example: --page 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

 !datadog list-events --event "6863321649093935973"
Output: 
ID                  ALERT-TYPE  TITLE       TEXT            TAGS                                HOST    DEVICE      PRIORITY 
6863321649093935973 error       helloEvents EventBodyHere   source:my_apps, tag1, tag2, tag3    kira    death Note  normal

docs.title: datadog list-logs
docs.text: List endpoint returns logs that match a log search query

docs.title: Description
docs.text: List endpoint returns logs that match a log search query

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog list-logs
    [--site <site>]
    [--query <query>]
    [--index <index>]
    [--from <from>]
    [--to <to>]
    [--storage_tier <storage_tier>]
    [--sort <sort>]
    [--cursor <cursor>]
    [--limit <limit>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Search query following logs syntax      Example: --query "query-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: For customers with multiple indexes      Example: --index "index-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: from - (time)
docs.text: Minimum timestamp for requested logs      Example: --from "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: 15 minutes ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: to - (time)
docs.text: Maximum timestamp for requested logs      Example: --to "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: storage_tier - (string)
docs.text: Specifies the storage type to be used      Example: --storage_tier "storage_tier-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: indexes, online-archives

docs.title: sort - (string)
docs.text: Order of logs in results      Example: --sort "sort-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: timestamp, -timestamp

docs.title: cursor - (string)
docs.text: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query      Example: --cursor "cursor-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: limit - (int)
docs.text: Maximum number of logs in the response.      Example: --limit 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!datadog list-logs --from "1 day ago"
Output: 
ID                                      STATUS  MESSAGE         TAGS    TIMESTAMP
AgAAAYYLZOvglWzodQAAAAAAA             info    Button Clicked  team:A    2019-01-02T09:42:36.320Z

docs.text: An arbitrary string to use for aggregation      Example: --aggregation_key "aggregation_key-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          max length: 100

docs.title: alert_type - (string)
docs.text: If an alert event is enabled, set its type      Example: --alert_type "error"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: error, warning, info, success, user_update, recommendation, snapshot

docs.title: date_happened - (int)
docs.text: POSIX timestamp of the event. Limited to events no older than 18 hours      Example: --date_happened 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: device - (string)
docs.text: A device name.      Example: --device "device-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: host - (string)
docs.text: Host name to associate with the event. Any tags associated with the host are also applied to this event      Example: --host "host-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: priority - (string)
docs.text: The priority of the event      Example: --priority "normal"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: normal, low

docs.title: related_event - (int)
docs.text: ID of the parent event      Example: --related_event 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: source_type - (string)
docs.text: The type of event being posted      Example: --source_type "source_type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: tags - (string)
docs.text: Tags to apply to the event      Example: --tags "tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: text - (string)
docs.text: The body of the event. Limited to 4000 characters. The text supports markdown. To use markdown in the event text, start the text block with %%% \n and end the text block with \n %%%      Example: --text "text-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: title - (string)
docs.text: The event title      Example: --title "title-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: datadog post-event --aggregation_key "aggregation_key-1" --alert_type "error" --date_happened 1 --device "device-1" --host "host-1" --priority "normal" --related_event 1 --source_type "source_type-1" --tags "tags-1" --text "text-1" --title "title-1"

docs.title: datadog schedule-downtime
docs.text: Schedule a downtime

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Schedule a downtime

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog schedule-downtime
    [--site <site>]
    [--disabled]
    [--end <end>]
    [--message <message>]
    [--id <id>]
    [--tags <tags>]
    [--mute_first_recovery_notification]
    [--parent <parent>]
    [--period <period>]
    [--rrule <rrule>]
    [--type <type>]
    [--until <until>]
    [--occurrences <occurrences>]
    [--days <days>]
    [--scope <scope>]
    [--start <start>]
    [--timezone <timezone>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: disabled - (bool)
docs.text: If a downtime has been disabled      Example: --disabled      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end - (time)
docs.text: time to end the downtime. If not provided, the downtime is in effect indefinitely until you cancel it      Example: --end "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: message - (string)
docs.text: A message to include with notifications for this downtime      Example: --message "message-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: id - (int)
docs.text: A single monitor to which the downtime applies. defaults to all monitors      Example: --id 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: tags - (string)
docs.text: Monitor tags. The resulting downtime applies to monitors that match ALL provided monitor tags      Example: --tags "tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: mute_first_recovery_notification - (bool)
docs.text: If the first recovery notification during a downtime should be muted      Example: --mute_first_recovery_notification      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: parent - (int)
docs.text: ID of the parent Downtime      Example: --parent 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: period - (int)
docs.text: How often to repeat(days) as an integer      Example: --period 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: rrule - (string)
docs.text: The RRULE standard for defining recurring events (requires to set "type" to rrule) Most common rrule options from the iCalendar Spec are supported      Example: --rrule "rrule-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: The type of recurrence      Example: --type "type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: days, weeks, months, years, rrule

docs.title: until - (time)
docs.text: The date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestamp. occurences and until are mutually exclusive      Example: --until "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: occurrences - (int)
docs.text: How many times the downtime is rescheduled. occurences and until are mutually exclusive      Example: --occurrences 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: days - (string)
docs.text: A list of week days to repeat on      Example: --days "days-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed      Validation:          allowed values: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun

docs.title: scope - (string)
docs.text: The scope(s) to which the downtime applies      Example: --scope "scope-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed      Validation:          allowed values: dev, prod

docs.title: start - (time)
docs.text: time to start the downtime. If not provided, the downtime starts the moment it is created      Example: --start "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: timezone - (string)
docs.text: The timezone in which to display the downtime's start and end times in Datadog applications      Example: --timezone "timezone-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: datadog schedule-downtime --disabled --end "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z" --message "message-1" --id 1 --tags "tags-1" --mute_first_recovery_notification --parent 1 --period 1 --rrule "rrule-1" --type "type-1" --until "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z" --occurrences 1 --days "days-1" --scope "scope-1" --start "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z" --timezone "timezone-1"

docs.title: datadog search-logs
docs.text: Returns logs that match log search query, to build complex logs filtering and search

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns logs that match log search query, to build complex logs filtering and search

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog search-logs
    [--site <site>]
    [--query <query>]
    [--index <index>]
    [--from <from>]
    [--to <to>]
    [--storage_tier <storage_tier>]
    [--sort <sort>]
    [--offset <offset>]
    [--timezone <timezone>]
    [--cursor <cursor>]
    [--limit <limit>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Search query following logs syntax      Example: --query "query-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: For customers with multiple indexes, the indexes to search Defaults to '*' which means all indexes      Example: --index "index-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: from - (time)
docs.text: Minimum timestamp for requested logs      Example: --from "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: 15 miniutes ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: to - (time)
docs.text: Maximum timestamp for requested logs      Example: --to "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: storage_tier - (string)
docs.text: Specifies the storage type to be used      Example: --storage_tier "storage_tier-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: indexes, online-archives

docs.title: sort - (string)
docs.text: Order of logs in results      Example: --sort "sort-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: timestamp, -timestamp

docs.title: offset - (duration)
docs.text: The time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query      Example: --offset "5 seconds"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: timezone - (string)
docs.text: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (America/New_York)      Example: --timezone "timezone-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cursor - (string)
docs.text: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query      Example: --cursor "cursor-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: limit - (int)
docs.text: Maximum number of logs in the response      Example: --limit 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!datadog search-logs --query "browser"
Output: 
ID                                      STATUS  TAGS    TIMESTAMP
AAAAAWgN8Xwgr1vKDQAAAABBV2dOOFh         INFO      team:A    2019-01-02T09:42:36.320Z

docs.title: datadog tag-configuration-cardinality-estimator
docs.text: Returns the estimated cardinality for a metric

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns the estimated cardinality for a metric

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog tag-configuration-cardinality-estimator
    [--site <site>]
    <metric_name>
    [--groups <groups>]
    [--hours <hours>]
    [--aggregations <aggregations>]
    [--percentile]
    [--timespan <timespan>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: optional

docs.title: metric_name - (string)
docs.text: Name of the metric      Example: "metric_name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: groups - (string)
docs.text: Filtered tag keys that the metric is configured to query with      Example: --groups "groups-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: hours - (duration)
docs.text: The duration to look back (from now) to estimate cardinality with      Example: --hours "5 seconds"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: aggregations - (int)
docs.text: The number of aggregations that a count, rate, or gauge metric is configured to use      Example: --aggregations 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          max: 9

docs.title: percentile - (bool)
docs.text: A boolean, for distribution metrics only, to estimate cardinality if the metric includes additional percentile aggregators      Example: --percentile      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: timespan - (duration)
docs.text: A window, in hours, from the look back to estimate cardinality with      Example: --timespan "5 seconds"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!datadog tag-configuration-cardinality-estimator --metric_name "datadog.dogstatsd.client.aggregated_context"
Output: 
ID                                          TYPE                        ESTIMATE-TYPE   ESTIMATED-AT                  ESTIMATED-OUTPUT-SERIES 
datadog.dogstatsd.client.aggregated_context metric_cardinality_estimate count_or_gauge  2023-01-08T02:59:13.450217Z   1

docs.title: rrule - (string)
docs.text: The RRULE standard for defining recurring events (requires to set "type" to rrule) Most common rrule options from the iCalendar Spec are supported      Example: --rrule "rrule-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: The type of recurrence      Example: --type "type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: days, weeks, months, years, rrule

docs.title: until - (int)
docs.text: The date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestamp. occurences and until are mutually exclusive      Example: --until 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: occurrences - (int)
docs.text: How many times the downtime is rescheduled. occurences and until are mutually exclusive      Example: --occurrences 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: days - (string)
docs.text: A list of week days to repeat on      Example: --days "days-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed      Validation:          allowed values: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun

docs.title: scope - (string)
docs.text: The scope(s) to which the downtime applies      Example: --scope "scope-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed      Validation:          allowed values: env:dev, env:prod

docs.title: start - (time)
docs.text: time to start the downtime. If not provided, the downtime starts the moment it is created      Example: --start "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: timezone - (string)
docs.text: The timezone in which to display the downtime's start and end times in Datadog applications      Example: --timezone "timezone-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: datadog update-downtime 1 --end "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z" --message "message-1" --id 1 --tags "tags-1" --mute_first_recovery_notification --parent 1 --period 1 --rrule "rrule-1" --type "type-1" --until 1 --occurrences 1 --days "days-1" --scope "scope-1" --start "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z" --timezone "timezone-1"

docs.title: storage_account - (string)
docs.text: Required associated storage account      Example: --storage_account "storage_account-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

    [--region <region>]
    [--tags <tags>]
    [--availability_zone <availability_zone>]
    [--volume_type <volume_type>]
    [--status <status>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: AWS region for the service      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: tags - (string)
docs.text: Tags assigned to the instance. Just specify the key to filter all resources with that tag key. Specity key=[value1,value2,...] to filter by acceptable values      Example: --tags "creator_id=[user1,user2]" , --tags "prod_env"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: availability_zone - (string)
docs.text: Availability Zone of the instance      Example: --availability_zone "us-west-1c"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: volume_type - (string)
docs.text: Volume type of the instance      Example: --volume_type "gp2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed      Validation:          allowed values: standard, io1, io2, gp2, sc1, st1, gp3

docs.title: status - (string)
docs.text: Status of the instance      Example: --status "in-use"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed      Validation:          allowed values: creating, available, in-use, deleting, deleted, error

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: ec2 list-volumes --region "region-1" --tags "creator_id=[user1,user2]" --availability_zone "us-west-1c" --volume_type "gp2" --status "in-use"

docs.title: ec2 reboot-instance

ec2 reboot-instance

    [--region <region>]

docs.title: instance_id - (string)

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: ec2 reboot-instance --region "region-1" "instance_id-1"

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)

docs.title: name - (string)

docs.title: min - (int)

docs.title: max - (int)

docs.title: desired_size - (int)

docs.title: elasticsearch cancel-tasks
docs.text: Cancel a long-running task

docs.title: Description
docs.text: If a long-running task supports cancellation, it can be cancelled with the cancel-tasks

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch cancel-tasks
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [--task_id <task_id>]
    [--actions <actions>]
    [--node_id <node_id>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: task_id - (string)
docs.text: Task Id to cancel      Example: --task_id "oTUltX4IQMOUUVeiohTt8A:124"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: actions - (string)
docs.text: Used to cancel multiple tasks of same action at a time      Example: --actions "cluster:*, *search"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: node_id - (string)
docs.text: Node IDs or names used to limit tasks to cancel      Example: --node_id "node-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: elasticsearch cancel-tasks --task_id "oTUltX4IQMOUUVeiohTt8A:124" --actions "cluster:, search" --node_id "node-1"

docs.title: elasticsearch clear-cache
docs.text: Clear the caches of one or more indices

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Clear the caches of one or more indices

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch clear-cache
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [--target <target>]
    [--fielddata]
    [--fields <fields>]
    [--query]
    [--request]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: target - (string)
docs.text: List of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request      Example: --target "students or _all"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: fielddata - (bool)
docs.text: If set, clears the cache. If fields argument is specified, cache is cleared for specified fields only      Example: --fielddata      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: fields - (string)
docs.text: List of field names used to limit the fielddata parameter. Defaults to all fields.      Example: --fields "foo"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: query - (bool)
docs.text: If set, clears the query cache      Example: --query      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: request - (bool)
docs.text: If set, clears the request cache      Example: --request      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch clear-cache --site "localhost" --cluster "elastic-1" --fielddata --target "class"
Output: 
{
  "_shards": {
    "total": 4,
    "successful": 2,
    "failed": 0
  }
}

docs.title: elasticsearch close-index
docs.text: Closes Index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Close open indices blocking all operations open indices allow

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch close-index
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <index>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Indices to close      Example: "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch close-index --site "localhost" --cluster "elastic-1" "test" "test1"
Output: 
{
  "acknowledged": true,
  "shards_acknowledged": true,
  "indices": {
    "test": {
      "closed": true
    },
    "test1": {
      "closed": true
    }
  }
}

docs.title: elasticsearch cluster-reroute
docs.text: Change the allocation of shards in a cluster.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Change the allocation of shards in a cluster.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch cluster-reroute
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [--dry_run]
    [--explain]
    [--retry_failed]
    --command <command>
    --index <index>
    --shard <shard>
    [--node <node>]
    [--to_node <to_node>]
    [--allow_primary]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: dry_run - (bool)
docs.text: If set, then the request simulates the operation and returns the resulting state, but will not actually perform the requested changes.      Example: --dry_run      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: explain - (bool)
docs.text: If set, then the response contains an explanation of why the commands can or cannot be executed.      Example: --explain      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: retry_failed - (bool)
docs.text: If set, then retries allocation of shards that are blocked due to too many subsequent allocation failures      Example: --retry_failed      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: command - (string)
docs.text: Command to perform. Can be either move/ cancel/ allocate_replica      Example: --command "move"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Index on which command is performed      Example: --index "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: shard - (int)
docs.text: Shard on which command is performed      Example: --shard 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: node - (string)
docs.text: Node from which shard should move or node from which shared allocation should be cancelled or node to which unassigned replica should be allocated      Example: --node "node2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: to_node - (string)
docs.text: In case of move command, node to which shard is moved      Example: --to_node "node2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: allow_primary - (bool)
docs.text: By default only replica shard allocations can be cancelled. If it is necessary to cancel the allocation of a primary shard then the allow_primary flag must be set      Example: --allow_primary      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples

! elasticsearch cluster-reroute --site "localhost" --cluster "elastic-1" --shard 1 --index "test1" --command "cancel" --node "beehyv-H81M-S"

docs.title: elasticsearch create-index
docs.text: Create a new elastic search index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create a new elastic search index

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch create-index
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <index>
    [--shards <shards>]
    [--replicas <replicas>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of the index to be created      Example: "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: shards - (int)
docs.text: Number of primary shards that an index should have      Example: --shards 1      Default: 1      Attributes: optional

docs.title: replicas - (int)
docs.text: Number of replicas      Example: --replicas 1      Default: 1      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch create-index --site "localhost" --cluster "elastic-1" --shards 4 --replicas 1 "my_source_index"
Output: 
{
  "acknowledged": true,
  "shards_acknowledged": true,
  "index": "class"
}

docs.title: elasticsearch delete-by-query
docs.text: Delete documents that match the specific query

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Delete documents that match the specific query

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch delete-by-query
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --query <query>
    [<index>]
    [--async]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Query string you wish to parse and use for filtering. Defined using Lucene query string syntax.      Example: --query "(new york city) OR (big apple)"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Indices to close      Example: "students"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: async - (bool)
docs.text: Create a task instead of waiting for completion      Example: --async      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch delete-by-query --site "localhost" --query "user.id:kimchy"
Output: 
{
  "took": 258,
  "timed_out": false,
  "total": 1,
  "deleted": 1,
  "batches": 1,
  "version_conflicts": 0,
  "noops": 0,
  "retries": {
    "bulk": 0,
    "search": 0
  },
  "throttled_millis": 0,
  "requests_per_second": -1.0,
  "throttled_until_millis": 0,
  "failures": []
}

docs.title: elasticsearch delete-document
docs.text: delete document from index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Removes a JSON document from the specified index.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch delete-document
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --index <index>
    <id>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of the index that contains the document.      Example: --index "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: id - (int)
docs.text: Unique identifier of the document.      Example: 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch delete-document --site "localhost" --cluster "elastic-1" --index "my-index-000001" 1
Output: 
{
  "_index": "my-index-000001",

  "_id": "1",
  "_version": 3,
  "result": "deleted",
  "_shards": {
    "total": 2,
    "successful": 1,
    "failed": 0
  },
  "_seq_no": 2,
  "_primary_term": 1
}

docs.title: site - (string)
