docs.title: jira create-issue
docs.text: Create Jira Issue.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create Jira Issue.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira create-issue
    --site <site>
    <project>
    --reporter <reporter>
    [--assignee <assignee>]
    --issue_type <issue_type>
    --summary <summary>
    [--priority <priority>]
    --description <description>
    [--update_history <update_history>]
    [--parent_issue <parent_issue>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: project - (string)
docs.text: The project ID (case sensitive)      Example: "project-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: reporter - (string)
docs.text: Id of reporter      Example: --reporter "reporter-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: assignee - (string)
docs.text: Id of assignee      Example: --assignee "assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: issue_type - (string)
docs.text: id of type of issue      Example: --issue_type "issue_type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: summary - (string)
docs.text: Summary of the issue      Example: --summary "summary-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: priority - (string)
docs.text: id of the issue priority      Example: --priority "priority-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: Description of the issue      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: update_history - (string)
docs.text: Whether the project of this issue is added to the user's recently viewed project list.      Example: --update_history "update_history-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: parent_issue - (string)
docs.text: Issue Id of parent required for subtasks, use only for creating subtasks.      Example: --parent_issue "parent_issue-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira create-issue "project-1" --reporter "reporter-1" --assignee "assignee-1" --issue_type "issue_type-1" --summary "summary-1" --priority "priority-1" --description "description-1" --update_history "update_history-1" --parent_issue "parent_issue-1"

docs.title: jira create-project-version
docs.text: create a new version of project.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: create a new version of project.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira create-project-version
    --site <site>
    [--description <description>]
    --name <name>
    [--archived]
    [--released]
    [--expand <expand>]
    <project>
    [--move_unfixed_issues_to <move_unfixed_issues_to>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: The description of the version.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The unique name of the version. Required when creating a version.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          max length: 255

docs.title: archived - (bool)
docs.text: Indicates that the version is archived.      Example: --archived      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: released - (bool)
docs.text: Indicates that the version is released. If the version is released a request to release again is ignored. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.      Example: --released      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: expand - (string)
docs.text: This parameter accepts operations, which returns actions that can be performed on the version.      Example: --expand "expand-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: project - (string)
docs.text: The project ID (case sensitive)      Example: "project-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: move_unfixed_issues_to - (string)
docs.text: The URL of the self link to the version to which all unfixed issues are moved when a version is released. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.      Example: --move_unfixed_issues_to "move_unfixed_issues_to-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira create-project-version --description "description-1" --name "name-1" --archived --released --expand "expand-1" "project-1" --move_unfixed_issues_to "move_unfixed_issues_to-1"

docs.title: jira create-project
docs.text: Creates a project based on a project type template.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a project based on a project type template.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira create-project
    --site <site>
    --key <key>
    --name <name>
    [--description <description>]
    --lead <lead>
    [--url <url>]
    [--default_assignee <default_assignee>]
    [--avatar <avatar>]
    [--issue_security_scheme <issue_security_scheme>]
    [--permission_scheme <permission_scheme>]
    [--notification_scheme <notification_scheme>]
    [--category <category>]
    --project_type <project_type>
    --project_template <project_template>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: key - (string)
docs.text: Project keys. The maximum length is 10 characters.      Example: --key "key-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          max length: 10

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the project.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: description of the project.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: lead - (string)
docs.text: The account ID of the project lead.      Example: --lead "lead-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          max length: 128

docs.title: url - (string)
docs.text: A link to information about this project, such as project documentation      Example: --url "url-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: default_assignee - (string)
docs.text: The default assignee when creating issues for this project.      Example: --default_assignee "default_assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: PROJECT_LEAD, UNASSIGNED

docs.title: avatar - (int)
docs.text: An integer value for the project's avatar.      Example: --avatar 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: issue_security_scheme - (int)
docs.text: ID of the issue security scheme, which enables you to control who can view issues.      Example: --issue_security_scheme 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: permission_scheme - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the permission scheme for the project.      Example: --permission_scheme "permission_scheme-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: notification_scheme - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the notification scheme for the project.      Example: --notification_scheme 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: category - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the project's category.      Example: --category 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: project_type - (string)
docs.text: Project type defines the application-specific feature set.      Example: --project_type "project_type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          allowed values: software, service_desk, business

docs.title: project_template - (string)
docs.text: A predefined configuration for a project.      Example: --project_template "project_template-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          allowed values: com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-simplified-agility-kanban, com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-simplified-agility-scrum, com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-simplified-basic, com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-simplified-kanban-classic, com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-simplified-scrum-classic, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-it-service-management, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-general-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-general-service-desk-it, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-general-service-desk-business, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-internal-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-external-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-hr-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-facilities-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-legal-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-marketing-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-finance-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-analytics-service-desk, com.atlassian.servicedesk:simplified-halp-service-desk, com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-content-management, com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-document-approval, com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-lead-tracking, com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-process-control, com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-procurement, com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-project-management, com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-recruitment, com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-task-

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira create-project --key "key-1" --name "name-1" --description "description-1" --lead "lead-1" --url "url-1" --default_assignee "default_assignee-1" --avatar 1 --issue_security_scheme 1 --permission_scheme "permission_scheme-1" --notification_scheme 1 --category 1 --project_type "project_type-1" --project_template "project_template-1"

docs.title: jira list-recent-projects

docs.title: jira update-custom-field
docs.text: Updates a custom field.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Updates a custom field.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira update-custom-field
    --site <site>
    --field_id <field_id>
    [--name <name>]
    [--description <description>]
    [--searcher_key <searcher_key>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: field_id - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the custom field.      Example: --field_id "field_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the custom field.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: The description of the custom field.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: searcher_key - (string)
docs.text: The searcher that defines the way the field is searched in Jira.      Example: --searcher_key "searcher_key-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: cascadingselectsearcher, daterange, datetimerange, exactnumber, exacttextsearcher, grouppickersearcher, labelsearcher, multiselectsearcher, numberrange, projectsearcher, textsearcher, userpickergroupsearcher, versionsearcher

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira update-custom-field --field_id "field_id-1" --name "name-1" --description "description-1" --searcher_key "searcher_key-1"

jira update-issue-comment

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: issue - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the issue.      Example: "issue-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: comment - (string)
docs.text: provide comment id      Example: --comment "comment-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: comments - (string)

docs.title: jira update-issue
docs.text: update issues for project

docs.title: Description
docs.text: update issues for project

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira update-issue
    --site <site>
    <issue>
    --fields <fields>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: issue - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the issue.      Example: "issue-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: fields - (string)
docs.text: fields to update as json string.      Example: --fields "{\"field1\" :{\"value\" : \"Value 1\"},\"field2\" :{\"value\" : \"Value 2\"}} "      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: jira update-project-version
docs.text: Update a version of project.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update a version of project.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira update-project-version
    --site <site>
    <version>
    [--description <description>]
    [--name <name>]
    [--archived]
    [--released]
    [--expand <expand>]
    [--move_unfixed_issues_to <move_unfixed_issues_to>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: version - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the version.      Example: "version-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: The description of the version. Optional when creating or updating a version.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The unique name of the version. Required when creating a version.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          max length: 255

docs.title: archived - (bool)
docs.text: Indicates that the version is archived. Optional when creating or updating a version.      Example: --archived      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: released - (bool)
docs.text: Indicates that the version is released. If the version is released a request to release again is ignored.      Example: --released      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: expand - (string)
docs.text: This parameter accepts operations, which returns actions that can be performed on the version.      Example: --expand "expand-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: move_unfixed_issues_to - (string)
docs.text: The URL of the self link to the version to which all unfixed issues are moved when a version is released. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.      Example: --move_unfixed_issues_to "move_unfixed_issues_to-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira update-project-version "version-1" --description "description-1" --name "name-1" --archived --released --expand "expand-1" --move_unfixed_issues_to "move_unfixed_issues_to-1"

docs.title: jira update-project
docs.text: Update a project based on a project type template.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update a project based on a project type template.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira update-project
    --site <site>
    <project>
    [--expand <expand>]
    --key <key>
    [--name <name>]
    [--description <description>]
    [--lead <lead>]
    [--url <url>]
    [--default_assignee <default_assignee>]
    [--avatar <avatar>]
    [--issue_security_scheme <issue_security_scheme>]
    [--permission_scheme <permission_scheme>]
    [--notification_scheme <notification_scheme>]
    [--category <category>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: project - (string)
docs.text: The project ID (case sensitive)      Example: "project-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: expand - (string)
docs.text: to include additional information in the response.      Example: --expand "expand-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: description, issueTypes, lead, projectKeys

docs.title: key - (string)
docs.text: Project keys. The maximum length is 10 characters.      Example: --key "key-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required      Validation:          max length: 10

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the project.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: description of the project.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: lead - (string)
docs.text: The account ID of the project lead.      Example: --lead "lead-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          max length: 128

docs.title: url - (string)
docs.text: A link to information about this project, such as project documentation      Example: --url "url-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: default_assignee - (string)
docs.text: The default assignee when creating issues for this project.      Example: --default_assignee "default_assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: PROJECT_LEAD, UNASSIGNED

docs.title: avatar - (int)
docs.text: An integer value for the project's avatar.      Example: --avatar 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: issue_security_scheme - (int)
docs.text: ID of the issue security scheme, which enables you to control who can view issues.      Example: --issue_security_scheme 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: permission_scheme - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the permission scheme for the project.      Example: --permission_scheme "permission_scheme-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: notification_scheme - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the notification scheme for the project.      Example: --notification_scheme 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: category - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the project's category.      Example: --category 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira update-project "project-1" --expand "expand-1" --key "key-1" --name "name-1" --description "description-1" --lead "lead-1" --url "url-1" --default_assignee "default_assignee-1" --avatar 1 --issue_security_scheme 1 --permission_scheme "permission_scheme-1" --notification_scheme 1 --category 1

docs.title: junos ping
docs.text: Ping remote target

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Ping remote target

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
junos ping
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <host>
    [--count <count>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of junos device      Example: --cluster "mx-1"      Default: junos-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: host - (string)
docs.text: Hostname or IP address of remote host      Example: "10.100.1.2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: count - (int)
docs.text: Number of ping requests to send      Example: --count 3      Default: 3      Attributes: optional

docs.title: junos show-route
docs.text: Show routing table information

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Show routing table information

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
junos show-route
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [<destination>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of junos device      Example: --cluster "mx-1"      Default: junos-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: destination - (string)
docs.text: IP address and optional prefix length of destination      Example: "10.100.1.2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples

!junos show-route "10.100.14.2"

docs.title: k8s create-job
docs.text: create job

docs.title: Description
docs.text: create job

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
k8s create-job
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [--namespace|-n <namespace>]
    [--image <image>]
    [--command <command>]
    [--command_args <command_args>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Cluster where this command will be executed      Example: --cluster "in-cluster"      Default: in-cluster      Attributes: optional

docs.title: namespace - (string)
docs.text: Kubernetes namespace      Example: --namespace "namespace-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: image - (string)
docs.text: Image name for this job      Example: --image "perl"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: command - (string)
docs.text: Command for this job      Example: --command "perl"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: command_args - (string)
docs.text: arg for the command      Example: --command_args "-Mbignum=bpi"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!k8s create-job --image "busybox" --command "/bin/sh" --command_args "-c" --command_args "date; echo Hello from the Kubernetes cluster"
Output: 
{
    "cluster": "in-cluster",
    "namespace": "default",
    "name": "default",
    "annotations": {
        "autopilot.gke.io/resource-adjustment": "{\"input\":{\"containers\":[{\"name\":\"default\"}]},\"output\":{\"containers\":[{\"limits\":{\"cpu\":\"500m\",\"ephemeral-storage\":\"1Gi\",\"memory\":\"2Gi\"},\"requests\":{\"cpu\":\"500m\",\"ephemeral-storage\":\"1Gi\",\"memory\":\"2Gi\"},\"name\":\"default\"}]},\"modified\":true}"
    },
    "labels": {
        "controller-uid": "1d962783-7c37-4701-af34-3527447858aa",
        "job-name": "default"
    }
}

docs.title: k8s get-pod-logs
docs.text: Get k8s pod logs

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get logs from kubernetes pods

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
k8s get-pod-logs
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [--namespace|-n <namespace>]
    <name>
    [--since <since>]
    [--since_time <since_time>]
    [--tail_lines <tail_lines>]
    [--limit_bytes <limit_bytes>]
    [--label_selector <label_selector>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Cluster where this command will be executed      Example: --cluster "in-cluster"      Default: in-cluster      Attributes: optional

docs.title: namespace - (string)
docs.text: Kubernetes namespace      Example: --namespace "namespace-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Name of the pod      Example: "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: since - (duration)
docs.text: Duration for which logs are required. Only one of since or since_time can be specified      Example: --since "5 seconds"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: since_time - (string)
docs.text: Timestamp from which logs required. Should follow RFC3339 standard      Example: --since_time "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: tail_lines - (int)
docs.text: the number of lines from the end of the logs to show      Example: --tail_lines 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: limit_bytes - (int)
docs.text: the number of bytes to read from the server before terminating the log output      Example: --limit_bytes 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: label_selector - (string)
docs.text: label selector to select pods to get logs for. Only used if name is not provided      Example: --label_selector "app=myapp"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! k8s get-pod-logs "hello-1629338580-jw8sf"
Output: 
{
     "logs": [
          "Thu Aug 19 02:03:06 UTC 2021",
          "Hello from the Kubernetes cluster",
          ""
     ]
}

docs.title: kafka alter-resource-config
docs.text: Alter config of kafka resources

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Alters config of a given kafka resource

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka alter-resource-config
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --resource_name <resource_name>
    --resource_type <resource_type>
    <entries>
    [--validate_only]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: resource_name - (string)
docs.text: Can be topic name or broker id      Example: --resource_name "resource_name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: resource_type - (string)
docs.text: Values can either be "TopicResource" or "BrokerResource"      Example: --resource_type "resource_type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: entries - (string)
docs.text: stringified Map with keys as config names and values as modified config values      Example: "entries-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: validate_only - (bool)
docs.text: Example: --validate_only      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka alter-resource-config --site "localhost" --resource_type "TopicResource" --resource_name "test-topic-1" `{"file.delete.delay.ms":"10000", "delete.retention.ms":"1000000"}`
Output: 
Config for the resource test-topic-1 updated

docs.title: kafka create-consumer
docs.text: Create kafka consumer

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka create-consumer
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <consuming_topic>
    [--all_partitions]
    [--partitions <partitions>]
    [--offset_option <offset_option>]
    [--offset_value <offset_value>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: consuming_topic - (string)
docs.text: Topic to be consumed      Example: "consuming_topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: all_partitions - (bool)
docs.text: boolean value to decide whether consumer should consume from all partitions      Example: --all_partitions      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: partitions - (int)
docs.text: partition number from which consumer should consume. Multiple partitions can be consumed      Example: --partitions 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: offset_option - (string)
docs.text: Value can be either "OLDEST" or "NEWEST"      Example: --offset_option "OLDEST" , --offset_option "NEWEST"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: offset_value - (int)
docs.text: offset from which messages are read in the provided partitions. Provide either offset_option or offset_value      Example: --offset_value 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka create-consumer --site "localhost" "test-topic-1" --partitions 1 --offset_option "NEWEST"
Output: 
Consumer for the topic "test-topic-1" created

docs.title: kafka create-partitions
docs.text: Create partitions for kafka topic

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Add additional partitions for a topic

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka create-partitions
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <topic>
    [--total_partition_count <total_partition_count>]
    [--assignment <assignment>]
    [--validate_only]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka topic      Example: "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: total_partition_count - (int)
docs.text: this count will be the sum of existing partitions and partitions to be created      Example: --total_partition_count 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: assignment - (string)
docs.text: Stringified value of replica assignment array. Number of replica assignments should be equal to number of new partitions      Example: --assignment "assignment-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: validate_only - (bool)
docs.text: Only validate whether partition can be created with provided values      Example: --validate_only      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka create-partitions --site "localhost" "test-topic-1" --total_partition_count 5 --assignment ‘[[1,2],[2,3]]’
Output: 
Partitions for the topic test-topic-1 created

docs.title: kafka create-topic
docs.text: create Kafka topic

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create topic with the provided name & config

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka create-topic
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <topic>
    [--validate_only]
    [--replication_factor <replication_factor>]
    [--num_partitions <num_partitions>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of the topic      Example: "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: validate_only - (bool)
docs.text: Only check if a topic can be created with provided config and not create topic in cluster      Example: --validate_only      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: replication_factor - (int)
docs.text: Replication factor      Example: --replication_factor 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: num_partitions - (int)
docs.text: Example: --num_partitions 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka create-topic --site "localhost" --cluster "default" "test-topic-1" --replication_factor 2 --num_partitions 3
Output: 
Topic "test-topic-1" is created

docs.title: kafka delete-topic
docs.text: Delete kafka topic

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Delete the topic provided from the cluster

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka delete-topic
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <topic>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of the topic      Example: "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka delete-topic --site "localhost" "test-topic-1"
Output: 
Topic "test-topic-1" is deleted

docs.title: kafka describe-topics
docs.text: Describe kafka topics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Describing topics gives more information like leader of partition, in sync replicas etc

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka describe-topics
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [<topics>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topics - (string)
docs.text: topic name that need to be fetched from cluster      Example: "topics-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka describe-topics --site "localhost" "test-topic-3"
Output: 
[
    {
        "name": "test-topic-3",
        "partitions": [
            {
                "leader": 2,
                "replicas": [2],
                "isr": [2]
            }
        ]
    }
]

docs.title: kafka get-broker-config
docs.text: Get Config for kafka broker Resource

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get one or more config for a given kafka broker resource

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-broker-config
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --broker_id <broker_id>
    [<config_names>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: broker_id - (string)
docs.text: broker id      Example: --broker_id "broker_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: config_names - (string)
docs.text: Name of config. If not provided, returns all the config of the resource      Example: "config_names-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

x = ! kafka get-brokerresource-config --broker_id "1" --site "localhost"

docs.title: kafka get-broker-metrics
docs.text: Get Kafka Broker metrics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get metrics for one broker or all kafka brokers combined

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-broker-metrics
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [--broker <broker>]
    [<beans>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: broker - (int)
docs.text: broker id      Example: --broker 1      Default: -1      Attributes: optional

docs.title: beans - ()
docs.text: list of beans      Example: "kafka.server"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x = ! kafka get-broker-metrics --site "localhost" --broker 1 --beans "kafka.server"
Output: 
{
  "brokerMetrics": [
    {
      "brokerId": 1,
      "beanMetrics": [
        {
          "bean": "kafka.server",
          "mbeanMetrics": [
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=KafkaServer,name=linux-disk-read-bytes",
              "metrics": [
                {
                  "attribute": "linux-disk-read-bytes",
                  "value": 22417408
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=KafkaServer,name=linux-disk-write-bytes",
              "metrics": [
                {
                  "attribute": "linux-disk-write-bytes",
                  "value": 11833344
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=ReplicaManager,name=*",
              "metrics": [
                {
                  "attribute": "PartitionCount",
                  "value": 3
                },
                {
                  "attribute": "LeaderCount",
                  "value": 2
                },
                {
                  "attribute": "AtMinIsrPartitionCount",
                  "value": 1
                },
                {
                  "attribute": "IsrExpands",
                  "value": 0.0001234603991556604
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=DelayedOperationPurgatory,name=PurgatorySize,delayedOperation=Produce",
              "metrics": []
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=DelayedOperationPurgatory,name=PurgatorySize,delayedOperation=Fetch",
              "metrics": [
                {
                  "attribute": "PurgatorySize",
                  "value": 121
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=*",
              "metrics": [
                {
                  "attribute": "TotalFetchRequests",
                  "value": 1.9917576217462
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=KafkaRequestHandlerPool,name=RequestHandlerAvgIdlePercent",
              "metrics": [
                {
                  "attribute": "RequestHandlerAvgIdlePercentMeanRate",
                  "value": 0.9999090453002375
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=Produce",
              "metrics": []
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=socket-server-metrics,listener={listener_name},networkProcessor={#},name=connection-count",
              "metrics": []
            },
            {
              "mbean": "kafka.server:type=socket-server-metrics,listener={listener_name},networkProcessor={#},name=connection-creation-rate",
              "metrics": []
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
Input: 
x = ! kafka get-broker-metrics --site "localhost" --broker 1
Output: 
{
  "brokerMetrics": [
    {
      "brokerId": 1,
      "metrics": [
        {
          "attribute": "TotalFetchRequests",
          "value": 1.9856422065406367
        },
        {
          "attribute": "HeapMemoryUsed",
          "value": 192278112
        },
        {
          "attribute": "NonHeapMemoryUsed",
          "value": 67263000
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
Input: 
! kafka get-broker-metrics --site "localhost" --broker 1
Output: 
BROKER_ID   LINUX-DISK-READ-BYTES   LINUX-DISK-WRITE-BYTES  ISR_EXPANDS AT_MIN_ISR_PARTITION_COUNT  PARTITION_COUNT LEADER_COUNT    PURGATORY_SIZE  TOTAL_FETCH_REQUESTS    REQUEST_HANDLER_AVG_IDLE_PERCENT_MEAN_RATE  HEAP_MEMORY_USED    NON_HEAP_MEMORY_USED    
        1                22421504                 12103680            0                          1                3            2               507                     1                                             0         182999488                71166816

docs.title: kafka get-brokers
docs.text: get kafka brokers

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get brokers in the cluster

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-brokers
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [<broker_ids>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: broker_ids - (int)
docs.text: ids for the brokers that are to be fetched      Example: 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka get-brokers --site "localhost" 1 2
Output: 
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "addr": "site-H81M-S:9093"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "addr": "site-H81M-S:9094"
  }
]

docs.title: kafka get-consumer-metrics
docs.text: Get kafka consumer metrics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get metrics for one or more consumer for a kafka consumer

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-consumer-metrics
    <metric>
    <consumer>

docs.title: metric - (string)
docs.text: Specify metric as string or Id      Example: "metric-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: consumer - (string)
docs.text: Specify consumer as string or Id      Example: "consumer-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: kafka get-consumer-metrics "metric-1" "consumer-1"

docs.title: kafka get-leader
docs.text: Get leader for Kafka topic partition

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get Leader of a particular partition of kafka topic

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-leader
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --topic <topic>
    <partition>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka topic      Example: --topic "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: partition - (int)
docs.text: Name of the partition      Example: 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka get-leader --site "localhost" --topic "test-topic-1" 1
Output: 
{
  "id": 1,
  "addr": "beehyv-H81M-S:9093"
}

docs.title: kafka get-offset
docs.text: Get offset for Kafka topic partition

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get offset of a particular partition of kafka topic

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-offset
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --topic <topic>
    <partition>
    [--offset_option <offset_option>]
    [--time <time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka topic      Example: --topic "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: partition - (int)
docs.text: Partition number      Example: 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: offset_option - (string)
docs.text: Takes one of the 2 values, "OLDEST" or "NEWEST". Provide either offset_option or time      Example: --offset_option "offset_option-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: time - (string)
docs.text: This gives the offset value at that point in time. Input should follow protobuf timestamp pattern (eg. 2020-09-01T21:46:43Z)      Example: --time "time-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka get-offset --site "localhost" --topic "test-topic-1" 1 --offset_option "NEWEST"
Output: 
1

docs.title: kafka get-producer-metrics
docs.text: Get kafka producer metrics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get metrics of a producer for a given topic or all topics combined

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-producer-metrics
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [<topic>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka topic      Example: "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: kafka get-producer-metrics "topic-1"

docs.title: kafka get-topic-config
docs.text: Get Config for kafka Topic Resource

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get one or more config for a given kafka topic resource

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-topic-config
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --topic <topic>
    [<config_names>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: topic name      Example: --topic "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: config_names - (string)
docs.text: Name of config. If not provided, returns all the config of the resource      Example: "config_names-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: kafka get-topic-config --topic "topic-1" "config_names-1"

docs.title: kafka get-topics
docs.text: Get Kafka topics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: List the topics available in the cluster with the default options or get certain topic if topic name is provided

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-topics
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [<topics>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topics - (string)
docs.text: topic name that need to be fetched from cluster      Example: "topics-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka get-topics --site "localhost" "test-topic-1" "test-topic-3"
Output: 
[
  {
    "test-topic-1": {
        "num_partitions": 1,
        "replication_factor": 1,
        "replica_assignment": {
            "0": {
                "replica": [3]
            }
        },
        "config_entries": {
            "segment.bytes": "1073741824"
        }
    },
    "test-topic-3": {
        "num_partitions": 1,
        "replication_factor": 1,
        "replica_assignment": {
            "0": {
                "replica": [2]
            }
        },
        "config_entries": {
            "segment.bytes": "1073741824"
        }
    }
  }
]

docs.title: kafka send-messages
docs.text: Send messages to kafka topic

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Send Messages to topic. Can be sent either synchronously or asynchronously

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka send-messages
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --topic <topic>
    [--asynchronous]
    [--messages <messages>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka topic      Example: --topic "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: asynchronous - (bool)
docs.text: Send messages asynchronously      Example: --asynchronous      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: messages - (string)
docs.text: Message to be sent      Example: --messages "messages-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka send-messages --site "localhost" --asynchronous --topic "test-topic-1" `{"key":"1","value":"hi"}` `{"key":"2","value":"hello"}`
Output: 
[
  {
    "topic_name":"test-topic-1",
    "offset":3,
    "time":{
      "seconds":1653551998,
      "nanos":115288839
    }
  },
  {
    "topic_name":"test-topic-1",
    "offset":4,
    "time":{
      "seconds":1653551998,
      "nanos":115590761
    }
  }
]

docs.title: kafka send-receive-messages
docs.text: Send messages to kafka topic and read with a comsumer

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Send Messages to topic and read them with a consumer.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka send-receive-messages
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    --topic <topic>
    [--asynchronous]
    [--messages <messages>]
    [--all_partitions]
    [--partitions <partitions>]
    [--offset_option <offset_option>]
    [--offset_value <offset_value>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka topic      Example: --topic "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: asynchronous - (bool)
docs.text: Send messages asynchronously      Example: --asynchronous      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: messages - (string)
docs.text: Message to be sent      Example: --messages "messages-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: all_partitions - (bool)
docs.text: boolean value to decide whether consumer should consume from all partitions      Example: --all_partitions      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: partitions - (int)
docs.text: partition number from which consumer should consume. Multiple partitions can be consumed      Example: --partitions 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: offset_option - (string)
docs.text: Value can be either "OLDEST" or "NEWEST"      Example: --offset_option "OLDEST" , --offset_option "NEWEST"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: offset_value - (int)
docs.text: offset from which messages are read in the provided partitions. Provide either offset_option or offset_value      Example: --offset_value 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka send-receive-messages --site "localhost" --asynchronous --topic "test-topic-1" `{"key":"1","value":"hi"}, {"key":"2","value":"hello"}` --partitions 1 --offset_option "OLDEST"
Output: 
[
  {
    "topic_name":"test-topic-1",
    "partition":1,
    "messages":[
      {
        "key":"1",
        "value":"hi"
      }
    ],
    "time":{
        "seconds":1653550892,
        "nanos":468828435
      }
  }
]

docs.title: pagerduty create-incidents
docs.text: Create incident

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create a PagerDuty incident

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty create-incidents
    --site <site>
    --from <from>
    --title <title>
    --service <service>
    [--priority <priority>]
    [--urgency <urgency>]
    [--assignee <assignee>]
    [--escalation_policy <escalation_policy>]
    [--conference_number <conference_number>]
    [--conference_url <conference_url>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: from - (string)
docs.text: Email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.      Example: --from "from-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: title - (string)
docs.text: A succinct description of the nature, symptoms, cause, or effect of the incident.      Example: --title "title-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: service - (string)
docs.text: service id to associate with this incident      Example: --service "service-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: priority - (string)
docs.text: priority id to associate with this incident      Example: --priority "priority-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: urgency - (string)
docs.text: urgency of the incidents to be returned. Allowed values [high, low]      Example: --urgency "urgency-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: high, low

docs.title: assignee - (string)
docs.text: user id of the users who are to be assigned the incident      Example: --assignee "assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: escalation_policy - (string)
docs.text: escalation policy ID for this incident      Example: --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: conference_number - (string)
docs.text: conference phone number to be used for this incident      Example: --conference_number "conference_number-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: conference_url - (string)
docs.text: conference url to be used for this incident      Example: --conference_url "conference_url-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty create-incidents --from "from-1" --title "title-1" --service "service-1" --priority "priority-1" --urgency "urgency-1" --assignee "assignee-1" --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1" --conference_number "conference_number-1" --conference_url "conference_url-1"

docs.title: pagerduty create-service
docs.text: Create a new service.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A service may represent an application, component, or team you wish to open incidents against.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty create-service
    --site <site>
    --name <name>
    --escalation_policy <escalation_policy>
    [--description <description>]
    [--auto_resolve_timeout <auto_resolve_timeout>]
    [--acknowledgement_timeout <acknowledgement_timeout>]
    [--status <status>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the service.      Example: --name "Test Service"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: escalation_policy - (string)
docs.text: id for escalation policy      Example: --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: The user-provided description of the service.      Example: --description "Test description"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: auto_resolve_timeout - (int)
docs.text: Time in seconds that an incident is automatically resolved.      Example: --auto_resolve_timeout 1      Default: 14400      Attributes: optional

docs.title: acknowledgement_timeout - (int)
docs.text: Time in seconds that an incident changes to the Triggered State after being Acknowledged.      Example: --acknowledgement_timeout 1      Default: 1800      Attributes: optional

docs.title: status - (string)
docs.text: The current state of the Service.      Example: --status "status-1"      Default: active      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: active, warning, critical, maintenance, disabled

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty create-service --name "Test Service" --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1" --description "Test description"

docs.title: name - (string)

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty create-team --name "Maira" --description "This is the new team created"

docs.title: pagerduty create-user
docs.text: Add user to your PagerDuty account.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Add a user from your PagerDuty account.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty create-user
    --site <site>
    --from <from>
    --name <name>
    --email <email>
    [--role <role>]
    [--title <title>]
    [--license_id <license_id>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: from - (string)
docs.text: Email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.      Example: --from "from-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the user.      Example: --name "FirstName LastName"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: email - (string)
docs.text: The user's email address.      Example: --email "test@maira.io"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: role - (string)
docs.text: The user role.      Example: --role "user"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: admin, limited_user, observer, owner, read_only_user, restricted_access, read_only_limited_user, user

docs.title: title - (string)
docs.text: The job title for the user.      Example: --title "Director of Marketing"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          max length: 100

docs.title: license_id - (string)
docs.text: License id assigned to the User      Example: --license_id "license_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty create-user --from "from-1" --name "FirstName LastName" --email "test@maira.io" --role "user" --title "Director of Marketing" --license_id "license_id-1"

docs.title: pagerduty get-incident-logs
docs.text: Get logs for an incident

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get logs for a PagerDuty incident

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty get-incident-logs
    --site <site>
    --id <id>
    [--overview]
    [--since <since>]
    [--until <until>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: id - (string)
docs.text: incident id      Example: --id "id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: overview - (bool)
docs.text: Get only overview log entries      Example: --overview      Default: false      Attributes: optional

docs.title: since - (time)
docs.text: The start of the date range over which you want to search. Maximum range is 6 months and default is 1 month.      Example: --since "1 month ago"      Default: 1 month ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: until - (time)
docs.text: The end of the date range over which you want to search. Maximum range is 6 months and default is 1 month.      Example: --until "now"      Default: now      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty get-incident-logs --id "id-1"

docs.title: pagerduty list-incidents
docs.text: List incidents

docs.title: Description
docs.text: List PagerDuty incidents

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty list-incidents
    --site <site>
    [--limit <limit>]
    [--offset <offset>]
    [--incident_key <incident_key>]
    [--include <include>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: limit - (int)
docs.text: The number of results per page.      Example: --limit 10      Default: 25      Attributes: optional

docs.title: offset - (int)
docs.text: Offset to start pagination search results.      Example: --offset 10      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: incident_key - (string)
docs.text: Return only the incidents associated with the passed team(s)      Example: --incident_key "incident_key-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: include - (string)
docs.text: Array of additional details to include      Example: --include "include-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed      Validation:          allowed values: users, services, first_trigger_log_entries, escalation_policies, teams, assignees, acknowledgers, priorities, conference_bridge

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

!pagerduty list-incidents --site "localhost:8081"

Q3TLHH2JYZA8M6  new user    Avinash         triggered

docs.title: pagerduty list-on-calls
docs.text: List the on-call entries.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: List the on-call entries during a given time range.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty list-on-calls
    --site <site>
    [--limit <limit>]
    [--since <since>]
    [--until <until>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: limit - (int)
docs.text: The number of results per page.      Example: --limit 10      Default: 25      Attributes: optional

docs.title: since - (time)
docs.text: The start of the date range over which you want to search. Maximum range is 6 months and default is 1 month.      Example: --since "1 month ago"      Default: 1 month ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: until - (time)
docs.text: The end of the date range over which you want to search. Maximum range is 6 months and default is 1 month.      Example: --until "now"      Default: now      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty list-on-calls

docs.title: pagerduty update-incident-alert

docs.text:
pagerduty update-incident-alert
    --site <site>
    --id <id>
    --alert_id <alert_id>
    --from <from>
    [--status <status>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: id - (string)
docs.text: incident id      Example: --id "id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: alert_id - (string)
docs.text: alert Id      Example: --alert_id "alert_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: from - (string)
docs.text: Email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.      Example: --from "from-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: status - (string)
docs.text: current status of the alert      Example: --status "status-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty update-incident-alert --id "id-1" --alert_id "alert_id-1" --from "from-1" --status "status-1"

docs.title: pagerduty update-incidents
docs.text: Update incident

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update a PagerDuty incident

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty update-incidents
    --site <site>
    --id <id>
    --from <from>
    --type <type>
    [--status <status>]
    [--priority <priority>]
    [--resolution <resolution>]
    [--urgency <urgency>]
    [--assignee <assignee>]
    [--escalation_level <escalation_level>]
    [--escalation_policy <escalation_policy>]
    [--conference_number <conference_number>]
    [--conference_url <conference_url>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: id - (string)
docs.text: incident id      Example: --id "id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: from - (string)
docs.text: Email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.      Example: --from "from-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: The incident type.      Example: --type "type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: status - (string)
docs.text: The new status of the incident.      Example: --status "status-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: resolved, acknowledged

docs.title: priority - (string)
docs.text: priority id to associate with this incident      Example: --priority "priority-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: resolution - (string)
docs.text: The resolution for this incident if status is set to resolved.      Example: --resolution "resolution-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: urgency - (string)
docs.text: urgency of the incidents to be returned      Example: --urgency "urgency-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: high, low

docs.title: assignee - (string)
docs.text: user id of the users who are to be assigne the incident      Example: --assignee "assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: escalation_level - (int)
docs.text: Escalate the incident to this level in the escalation policy.      Example: --escalation_level 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: escalation_policy - (string)
docs.text: escalation policy for this incident      Example: --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: conference_number - (string)
docs.text: conference phone number to be used for this incident      Example: --conference_number "conference_number-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: conference_url - (string)
docs.text: conference url to be used for this incident      Example: --conference_url "conference_url-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty update-incidents --id "id-1" --from "from-1" --type "type-1" --status "status-1" --priority "priority-1" --resolution "resolution-1" --urgency "urgency-1" --assignee "assignee-1" --escalation_level 1 --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1" --conference_number "conference_number-1" --conference_url "conference_url-1"

docs.title: pagerduty update-services
docs.text: Update existing services.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update existing services.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty update-services
    --site <site>
    --id <id>
    [--name <name>]
    [--description <description>]
    [--auto_resolve_timeout <auto_resolve_timeout>]
    [--acknowledgement_timeout <acknowledgement_timeout>]
    [--alert_creation <alert_creation>]
    [--status <status>]
    --escalation_policy <escalation_policy>
    [--active]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: id - (string)
docs.text: ID of the service.      Example: --id "id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the service.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: description of webhook subscription      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: auto_resolve_timeout - (int)
docs.text: Time in seconds, incident is automatically resolved if left open for that long.      Example: --auto_resolve_timeout 1      Default: 14400      Attributes: optional

docs.title: acknowledgement_timeout - (int)
docs.text: Time in seconds that an incident changes to the Triggered State after being Acknowledged.      Example: --acknowledgement_timeout 1      Default: 1800      Attributes: optional

docs.title: alert_creation - (string)
docs.text: Whether a service creates only incidents, or both alerts and incidents.      Example: --alert_creation "alert_creation-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: create_incidents, create_alerts_and_incidents

docs.title: status - (string)
docs.text: The current state of the Service.      Example: --status "status-1"      Default: active      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: active, warning, critical, maintenance, disabled

docs.title: escalation_policy - (string)
docs.text: The Escalation Policy id      Example: --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: active - (bool)
docs.text: If true, a webhook will be sent.      Example: --active      Default: true      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty update-services --id "id-1" --name "name-1" --description "description-1" --alert_creation "alert_creation-1" --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"

docs.title: pagerduty update-user
docs.text: Update user to your PagerDuty account.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update a user from your PagerDuty account.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty update-user
    --site <site>
    --user_id <user_id>
    --name <name>
    --email <email>
    [--role <role>]
    [--title <title>]
    [--license_id <license_id>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: user_id - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the user.      Example: --user_id "PAGNO81"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the user.      Example: --name "FirstName LastName"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: email - (string)
docs.text: The user's email address.      Example: --email "test@maira.io"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: role - (string)
docs.text: The user role.      Example: --role "user"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          allowed values: admin, limited_user, observer, owner, read_only_user, restricted_access, read_only_limited_user, user

docs.title: title - (string)
docs.text: The job title for the user.      Example: --title "Director of Marketing"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional      Validation:          max length: 100

docs.title: license_id - (string)
docs.text: License id assigned to the User      Example: --license_id "license_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!pagerduty update-user --site "localhost:8081" --user_id "PAGNO81" --name "AB" --email "testMail@email.com"

docs.title: prometheus clean-tombstones
docs.text: Clean Tombstones

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Clean Tombstones removes the deleted data from disk and cleans up the existing tombstones. This can be used after deleting series to free up space.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus clean-tombstones
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus clean-tombstones --site "localhost"
Output:

docs.title: prometheus delete-series
docs.text: Delete data for a selection of series in a time range

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Delete data for a selection of series in a time range. The actual data still exists on disk and is cleaned up in future compactions or can be explicitly cleaned up by hitting the Clean Tombstones endpoint.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus delete-series
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    [--start_time <start_time>]
    [--end_time <end_time>]
    <series_selector>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start_time - (string)
docs.text: Start timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --start_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (string)
docs.text: End timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --end_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: series_selector - (string)
docs.text: label matcher argument that selects the series to delete. At least one series_selector argument must be provided.      Example: "up"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus delete-series --site "localhost" "up"
Output:

docs.title: prometheus get-alertmanagers
docs.text: Get the Prometheus alertmanager discovery

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns an overview of the current state of the Prometheus alertmanager discovery. Both the active and dropped Alertmanagers are part of the response

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-alertmanagers
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus get-alertmanagers --site "localhost"
Output: 
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "activeAlertmanagers": [
      {
        "url": "http://localhost:9093/api/v2/alerts"
      }
    ],
    "droppedAlertmanagers": []
  }
}

docs.title: prometheus get-alerts
docs.text: Get the list of active alerts

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns a list of active alerts

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-alerts
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus get-alerts --site "localhost"
Output: 
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "alerts": [
      {
        "labels": {
          "alertname": "InstanceDown",
          "instance": "localhost:9100",
          "job": "node-exporter",
          "severity": "critical"
        },
        "annotations": {
          "description": "[localhost:9100] of job [node-exporter] has been down for more than 1 minute.",
          "summary": "Instance [localhost:9100] down"
        },
        "state": "firing",
        "activeAt": "2021-10-13T12:05:20.566139241Z",
        "value": "0e+00"
      },
      {
        "labels": {
          "alertname": "InstanceDown",
          "instance": "localhost:1234",
          "job": "kafka",
          "severity": "critical"
        },
        "annotations": {
          "description": "[localhost:1234] of job [kafka] has been down for more than 1 minute.",
          "summary": "Instance [localhost:1234] down"
        },
        "state": "firing",
        "activeAt": "2021-10-13T12:05:20.566139241Z",
        "value": "0e+00"
      }
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: prometheus get-config
docs.text: Get currently loaded configuration

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns currently loaded configuration file

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-config
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus get-config --site "localhost"
Output: 
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "yaml": "global:
  scrape_interval: 15s
  scrape_timeout: 10s
  evaluation_interval: 15s
alerting:
  alertmanagers:
  - follow_redirects: true
    scheme: http
    timeout: 10s
    api_version: v2
    static_configs:
    - targets:
      - localhost:9093
rule_files:
- /usr/local/bin/prometheus/prometheus_rules.yml
scrape_configs:
- job_name: prometheus
  honor_timestamps: true
  scrape_interval: 15s
  scrape_timeout: 10s
  metrics_path: /metrics
  scheme: http
  follow_redirects: true
  static_configs:
  - targets:
    - localhost:9090
- job_name: node-exporter
  honor_timestamps: true
  scrape_interval: 15s
  scrape_timeout: 10s
  metrics_path: /metrics
  scheme: http
  follow_redirects: true
  static_configs:
  - targets:
    - localhost:9100
- job_name: kafka
  honor_timestamps: true
  scrape_interval: 15s
  scrape_timeout: 10s
  metrics_path: /metrics
  scheme: http
  follow_redirects: true
  static_configs:
  - targets:
    - localhost:1234
"
  }
}

docs.title: prometheus get-label-values
docs.text: Get label values for a provided label name

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns a list of label values for a provided label name

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-label-values
    [--site <site>]
    [--cluster <cluster>]
    <label>
    [--series_selector <series_selector>]
    [--start_time <start_time>]
    [--end_time <end_time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: label - (string)
docs.text: Name of the label for which values are returned      Example: "job"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: series_selector - (string)
docs.text: Series selector argument that selects the series from which label values are read      Example: --series_selector "up"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: start_time - (string)
docs.text: Start timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --start_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (string)
docs.text: End timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --end_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus get-label-values --site "localhost" --start_time "2021-10-19T20:10:51.781Z" --end_time "2021-10-20T20:10:51.781Z" --series_selector "up" "instance"
Output: 
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": ["localhost:1234", "localhost:9090", "localhost:9100"]
}

docs.title: prometheus get-metric-metadata

    [--metric <metric>]
    [--limit <limit>]
